remarks.format: ## Remarks 编码是将一组 Unicode 字符转换为一个字节序列的过程。Encoding is the process of transforming a set of Unicode characters into a sequence of bytes. 解码是将编码字节序列转换为一组 Unicode 字符的过程。Decoding is the process of transforming a sequence of encoded bytes into a set of Unicode characters. UTF-8 是一种 Unicode 编码，它将每个码位表示为一至四个字节的序列。UTF-8 is a Unicode encoding that represents each code point as a sequence of one to four bytes. 与 UTF-16 和 UTF-32 编码不同，UTF-8 编码不需要 "endian";无论处理器是大字节序还是小型字节序，编码方案都是相同的。Unlike the UTF-16 and UTF-32 encodings, the UTF-8 encoding does not require "endianness"; the encoding scheme is the same regardless of whether the processor is big-endian or little-endian. 对应于 Windows 代码页65001。 corresponds to the Windows code page 65001. 有关 支持的 UTFs 和其他编码的详细信息，请参阅[.NET Framework 中的字符编码](~/docs/standard/base-types/character-encoding.md)。For more information about the UTFs and other encodings supported by , see [Character Encoding in the .NET Framework](~/docs/standard/base-types/character-encoding.md). 您可以通过多种方式实例化 100,000-character segments), use the and properties, respectively. （可选） 对象提供字节顺序标记（BOM），这是一个字节数组，可以在编码过程中生成的字节流开头加上前缀。Optionally, the object provides a byte order mark (BOM), which is an array of bytes that can be prefixed to the beginning of the byte stream that results from the encoding process. 如果 UTF-8 编码的字节流以字节顺序标记（BOM）开头，则它有助于解码器确定字节顺序和转换格式或 UTF。If a UTF-8 encoded byte stream is prefaced with a byte order mark (BOM), it helps the decoder determine the byte order and the transformation format or UTF. 但请注意，Unicode 标准既不需要也不建议使用 UTF-8 编码流中的 BOM。Note, however, that the Unicode Standard neither requires nor recommends a BOM in UTF-8 encoded streams. 有关字节顺序和字节顺序标记的详细信息，请参阅[unicode 主页](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=37123)上的 unicode 标准。For more information on byte order and remarks.format: ## Remarks 对象可以提供前导码，这是一个字节数组，可以作为编码过程中所产生的字节序列的前缀。The object can provide a preamble, which is a byte array that can be prefixed to the sequence of bytes that result from the encoding process. 前面有一个字节顺序标记（码位 U + FEFF）的已编码字节序列，可帮助解码器确定字节顺序和转换格式，或 UTF。Prefacing a sequence of encoded bytes with a byte order mark (code point U+FEFF) helps the decoder determine the byte order and the transformation format, or UTF. Unicode 字节顺序标记（BOM）序列化为 0xEF 0xBB 0xBF。The Unicode byte order mark (BOM) is serialized as 0xEF 0xBB 0xBF. 请注意，Unicode 标准既不需要也不建议使用 UTF-8 编码流的 BOM。Note that the Unicode Standard neither requires nor recommends the use of a BOM for UTF-8 encoded streams. 可以实例化对象，其方法按以下方式返回有效的 BOM：You can instantiate a object whose method returns a valid BOM in the following ways: - 通过检索 属性返回的 对象。By retrieving the object returned by the property. - 通过使用 `encoderShouldEmitUTF8Identifier` 参数调用 构造函数并将其值设置为 "`true`"。By calling a constructor with a `encoderShouldEmitUTF8Identifier` parameter and setting its value set to `true`. 所有其他对象配置为返回空数组而不是有效的 BOM。All other objects are configured to return an empty array rather than a valid BOM. BOM 为某些文件提供了几乎特定的编码标识，否则这些文件会丢失对其编码的引用，例如未标记或标记错误的 web 数据，或在业务不存在国际问题时存储的随机文本文件。The BOM provide nearly certain identification of an encoding for files that otherwise have lost a reference to their encoding, such as untagged or improperly tagged web data or random text files stored when a business did not have international concerns. 如果数据一致且标记正确，通常可以避免用户问题。Often user problems might be avoided if data is consistently and properly tagged. 对于提供编码类型的标准，BOM 有些多余。For standards that provide an encoding type, a BOM is somewhat redundant. 但是，可以使用它来帮助服务器发送正确的编码标头。However, it can be used to help a server send the correct encoding header. 或者，它可以用作回退，以防编码在其他情况下丢失。Alternatively, it can be used as a fallback in case the encoding is otherwise lost. 使用 BOM 存在一些缺点。There are some disadvantages to using a BOM. 例如，了解如何限制使用 BOM 的数据库字段可能很困难。For example, knowing how to limit the database fields that use a BOM can be difficult. 文件的串联可能也是一个问题，例如，当文件以这样一种方式进行合并时，不需要的字符会在数据中间结束。Concatenation of files can be a problem also, for example, when files are merged in such a way that an unnecessary character can end up in the middle of data. 但尽管有几个缺点，但强烈建议使用 BOM。In spite of the few disadvantages, however, the use of a BOM is highly recommended. 有关字节顺序和字节顺序标记的详细信息，请参阅[unicode 主页](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=37123)上的 unicode 标准。For more information on byte order and the byte order mark, see The Unicode Standard at the [Unicode home page](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=37123). > [!IMPORTANT] > 若要确保已编码的字节在另存为文件或流时正确解码，可以使用前导码作为编码字节流开头的前缀。To ensure that the encoded bytes are decoded properly when they are saved as a file or as a stream, you can prefix the beginning of a stream of encoded bytes with a preamble. 请注意， 方法不会将 BOM 预置到已编码的字节序列;开发人员负责在相应的字节流的开头提供 BOM。Note that the method does not prepend a BOM to a sequence of encoded bytes; supplying a BOM at the beginning of an appropriate byte stream is the developer's responsibility. ## Examples 下面的示例使用 方法返回以 UTF-8 格式编码的 Unicode 字节顺序标记。The following example uses the method to return the Unicode byte order mark encoded in UTF-8 format. 请注意， 的无参数构造函数不提供前导码。Notice that the parameterless constructor for does not provide a preamble. remarks.format: ## Remarks 对象可以提供前导码，这是一个字节范围，可以作为编码过程中所产生的字节序列的前缀。The object can provide a preamble, which is a span of bytes that can be prefixed to the sequence of bytes that result from the encoding process. 前面有一个字节顺序标记（码位 `U+FEFF`）的已编码字节序列，这有助于解码器确定字节顺序和转换格式，或 UTF。Prefacing a sequence of encoded bytes with a byte order mark (code point `U+FEFF`) helps the decoder determine the byte order and the transformation format, or UTF. Unicode 字节顺序标记（BOM）序列化为 0xEF 0xBB 0xBF。The Unicode byte order mark (BOM) is serialized as 0xEF 0xBB 0xBF. 请注意，Unicode 标准既不需要也不建议使用 UTF-8 编码流的 BOM。Note that the Unicode Standard neither requires nor recommends the use of a BOM for UTF-8 encoded streams. 可以通过以下方式实例化其 `Preamble` 为有效 BOM 的 对象：You can instantiate a object whose `Preamble` is a valid BOM in the following ways: - 通过检索 属性返回的 对象。By retrieving the object returned by the property. - 通过使用 `encoderShouldEmitUTF8Identifier` 参数调用 构造函数并将其值设置为 "`true`"。By calling a constructor with an `encoderShouldEmitUTF8Identifier` parameter and setting its value set to `true`. 所有其他 对象都配置为返回默认跨度，而不是有效的 BOM。All other objects are configured to return a default span rather than a valid BOM. BOM 为某些文件提供了几乎特定的编码标识，否则这些文件会丢失对其编码的引用，例如未标记或标记错误的 web 数据，或在业务不存在国际问题时存储的随机文本文件。The BOM provides nearly certain identification of an encoding for files that otherwise have lost a reference to their encoding, such as untagged or improperly tagged web data or random text files stored when a business did not have international concerns. 如果数据一致且标记正确，通常可以避免用户问题。Often user problems might be avoided if data is consistently and properly tagged. 对于提供编码类型的标准，BOM 有些多余。For standards that provide an encoding type, a BOM is somewhat redundant. 但是，可以使用它来帮助服务器发送正确的编码标头。However, it can be used to help a server send the correct encoding header. 或者，它可以用作回退，以防编码在其他情况下丢失。Alternatively, it can be used as a fallback in case the encoding is otherwise lost. 使用 BOM 存在一些缺点。There are some disadvantages to using a BOM. 例如，了解如何限制使用 BOM 的数据库字段可能很困难。For example, knowing how to limit the database fields that use a BOM can be difficult. 文件的串联可能也是一个问题，例如，当文件以这样一种方式进行合并时，不需要的字符会在数据中间结束。Concatenation of files can be a problem also, for example, when files are merged in such a way that an unnecessary character can end up in the middle of data. 但尽管有几个缺点，但强烈建议使用 BOM。In spite of the few disadvantages, however, the use of a BOM is highly recommended. 有关字节顺序和字节顺序标记的详细信息，请参阅[unicode 主页](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=37123)上的 unicode 标准。For more information on byte order and the byte order mark, see The Unicode Standard at the [Unicode home page](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=37123). > [!IMPORTANT] > 若要确保已编码的字节在另存为文件或流时正确解码，可以使用前导码作为编码字节流开头的前缀。To ensure that the encoded bytes are decoded properly when they are saved as a file or as a stream, you can prefix the beginning of a stream of encoded bytes with a preamble. 请注意， 方法不会将 BOM 预置到已编码的字节序列;开发人员负责在相应的字节流的开头提供 BOM。Note that the method does not prepend a BOM to a sequence of encoded bytes; supplying a BOM at the beginning of an appropriate byte stream is the developer's responsibility.
